intro: Anthocleista djalonensis, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Anthocleista djalonensis is often found in moist forested areas and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
